lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Signing up for Art Class

sentence.idiomatic: You have a lot of options, you can take your time to think about it.
I have chosen to go work in China.
Someone loving you or you loving someone--which would you choose?
He does not have even the basics of dancing down.
You have a better foundation than him.
I studied Chinese diligently in university, so my foundation is quite good.
What you said is reasonable, I agree.
What he did didn't make any sense.
For what he said, you can listen to the reasonable part and ignore the unreasonable part.
I don’t think stinky tofu smells bad at all--it smells good.
Throw these dirty things away now, they stink!
It stinks! Did you break wind?
He sacrificed himself for the sake of defending his country.
These soldiers who sacrificed themselves were all young.
He sacrificed a lot of his down time to be with me, I am really touched.
What do you want to study?
I don't know. There is so much to choose from! Traditional Chinese painting, oil painting, watercolor, drawing...
We don't even know the basics, we had better study something simple.
That makes sense. Tell me which one is easy to learn.
Chinese traditional painting, because when I was young I studied calligraphy.
Are you sure about that? What does that have to do with anything?
They both use a writing brush. Now, what do you want to study?
Hmm... oil painting.
It's difficult, plus the paints are smelly.
So what? I'll suffer for art's sake!
